replies.bodyText: This is mostly a separate thing. Slava pointed out that this API didn't include the URI for a term (which was added with the OAI-ORE/Bag work from QDR). Since this was a one line change related to semantics, I added it here but the rest of the changes do not depend on this API having the extra field.

commits_in_main.message: adjust incoming identifier for HttpOverlay drivers
Resolved Globus API for multiple files input (dv version 5.3 )
mimeType is calculated only from file extension
- tweak datasetlock, - skip checksum validation using dataset category
make sure release user is set
- tweak datasetlock, - skip checksum validation using dataset category
Assign a version if not set
- added GLOBUSUPLOADSUCCESS notification type and user notification messages - added deleteRule api -
api to delete globus rule and added notification
handle mutliple versions, setting pub/release dates correctly
correction to verify ruleID existence, added ChecksumDatasetSizeLimit and ChecksumFileSizeLimit settings
cleanup : removed redundant code from Phase 1
mirror responses from publish command - accepted(w /wf) or ok
DD-526 create url for custom terms (#99)
DD-526 create url for custom terms (#103)
add flag required to also update PID at provider during migrate
add a curation status report api call
refactor to support support addFiles api from #7901
DD-573 Implement set license in semantic api (#113)
don't need to be super to get allowed curation labels in set
fix unset - check perm on dataset not its owner
old logic - only check released and ! superuser
changing action logging to include userIdentifier
handle null, update user id used, change actiontype for create/delete
prevents the file upload api from defaulting to "text/plain" for the mime type, when no Content-Type: header is found in the incoming data part. (#8344)
Basic framework for a lock-listing API. Work in progress, lots to figure out/finalize. (IQSS/dataverse.harvard.edu#135)
Expanding the locks API to list locks installation-wide, across all datasets. (IQSS/dataverse.harvard.edu#135)
Refactor to RemoteOverlay, use constants for store types/sep
move globus calls to globus bean, doc Lock issue, cleaunup
handle name and dataset/version changes from 8696 review
minor error meg and comment changes
add checking w.r.t. dataset storage driver/base driver
strip any html from archival status
#8859 check for valid terms prior to embargo
#8859 update api message prior to command; update tests
add tool callback methods for dataset and datafile
fix for cvv and editMetadata replace=true, and test
replaced listAllFiles and deleteFile with cleanUp in the StorageIO interface
better filter for files to delete
Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse into dataset_files_cleanup
simplified for loop: loop directly on DataFiles of dataset, not over each version separately
Refactor: deleteDataset endpoint uses AuthFilter instead of findUserOrDie
Refactor: new AbstractApiBean method for retrieving user from ContainerRequestContext
Refactor: all Datasets API findUserOrDie calls replaced by AuthFilter
Fixed: missing AuthFilter setup for Datasets getVersionJsonLDMetadata endpoint call
removed split limit when splitting the storage identifier
legacy files generate only a warning now, no error is returned
Refactor: new response method within AbstractApiBean for handling user requests by handling filter-comming user instead of findUserOrDie method
Refactor: using ApiConstants in all places for common API statuses
Refactor: using new filter-based auth on missing dataset endpoint

timeline.author: pdurbin

replies.bodyText: Description is a multi-valued field so this could be a JsonObject or JsonArray. The added logic here handles both cases. Nominally this is also separable from the API itself - just caught in testing along the way. Could be moved to a separate PR.
replies.author: qqmyers

replies.bodyText: Oh, I see the added logic now. Thanks.
replies.author: pdurbin

timeline.message: add create example, remove solr schema copies file
add missing create method (in migrate PR)
merge new fields with existing ones
differences from IQSS/develop that break compilation

Merge remote-tracking branch 'IQSS/develop' into IQSS/6497-semantic_api

Conflicts:
	src/main/java/edu/harvard/iq/dataverse/api/Datasets.java
Add jsonld lib to compact to local context
move debug ore generation after configuring dataset
set versionstate, simplify, move terms init outside loop
add support for fields with their own formal URI
allow non-published to support debugging and future use
expanded has array with 1 val - handle it
compact with no context for decontextualize
sort compound field children by display order

Revert "sort compound field children by display order"

This reverts commit 8596ac80ef206f9141cfc9815c0e98ccf718b327.
now use Uri instead of label when matching terms
additional debug, always set display order
generate URIs for child types to match current ore maps
allow oremap to work w/o modified date for debug

fix compound value iteration

don't replace existing value - always add a new value, but, if not
appending, clear the list of values to start

fix ttype map for terms with no uri - use title not name

as is done currently in generating the ORE map

handle date format variations, including DV internal ones

see note in Dataverses - using Date() versus Timestamp() causes a
difference in precision and, perhaps surprisingly, a difference in the
response from version.getLastUpdateTime().toString() in creating the
OREmap.
and the format in current published bags
initial endpoint to release a migrated dataset

use Finalize Publication command

Curate is for cases with an existing published version and migrated
datasets only have 1 version

Also - don't want to go through Publish command since it creates new
version numbers, etc.
add debug, allow more details in 400 responses

create transfer bag type with orig files

handle no checksums on orig files

Merge remote-tracking branch 'IQSS/develop' into IQSS/6497-semantic_api

Conflicts:
	src/main/java/edu/harvard/iq/dataverse/api/Datasets.java
add semantic metadata api call only

fix error handling

FWIW: We have an error handler for the
edu.harvard.iq.dataverse.util.json.JsonParseException class but not for
javax.json.stream.JsonParsingException which was getting caught by the
Throwable handler and returned as a 500 error with json message {}
handle append on terms - fix cut/paste errors
make replace still append for multiple val fields

track defined namespaces

and avoid having contexts with specific entries for terms that are in a
namespace already
define equals, avoid duplicates in list
Fix multiple description logic for info file

add method that can return JsonObjectBuilder

which can be used with existing AbstractApiBean.ok()
Java 11 update and test fixes inc. for different exception mesg
update pom for v11 and running tests under 11

Merge branch 'iqssdevelop' into IQSS/6497-semantic_api

Conflicts:
	pom.xml

fix for edu.harvard.iq.dataverse.api.AdminIT test fail in Java 11

The DV code tested in testLoadMetadataBlock_ErrorHandling assumed it
could parse the message of an ArrayOutOfBounds exception as an it to
determine the column that fails. This message is now a String. Rather
than parse it (and fail if it changes), I modified the code so that the
length of the values array is visible in the catch and can be sent
directly (the first out of bounds index is if/when the index is
values.length).
